revised_title: Pigeons and the Riddle of Natural Categorization
tldr: This article explores how pigeons and other animals can rapidly categorize complex visual stimuli, such as photographs or drawings, despite lacking language and higher cognitive capacities. The author discusses experiments where pigeons were trained to identify trees in various photographs and found that they could learn and generalize the category of trees even when the stimuli were constantly changing. The findings challenge traditional theories of reinforcement and suggest that pigeons may have unique cognitive abilities for natural categorization.
